content.description: This route has three starts, one up the hand crack on the west side of the buttress, one up the bolted slab in the middle and the other on the right side of the dihedral. Meet at the first roof and continue up to the anchors.
content.location: These routes are right of the Eye of the Pyramid.

content.description: Named for the fact that it was originally done with no bolts or protection, however this route now has two bolts and is mainly used to reach the belay for Black Powder but can easily be combined into one pitch.
content.location: To the left of The Overhang at the slabby ramp.

content.description: Fun liebacking moves. Cant imagine being the first one to climb this but saw it wasnt on Mountain project. Route starts to the left of on belay with god on top of the boulder. Start with some liebacking on a blank slab. The start is the crux but after the first 5 feet it eases up significantly. The crack could fit some trad gear very nicely or just scramble up to the anchors and set a top rope.
content.protection: Some cams or just set up a top rope.
content.location: This route starts to the left of on belay with god on top of the large boulder. The crack is very obvious and you wont miss it. Also one of the 3 starts to the overhang.

climbs.name: Hosey Rosey
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan, Bob Cable, Kenn Kenaga, Kevin Graves 4/04

content.description: A fun hand and fist crack to a well protected chimney.
content.protection: Up to fist sized gear, 2 bolts, same anchors as Fish and Game.
content.location: Between Eye of the Pyramid and Fish and Game.

content.description: A fun way to get to the top of the formation. Start up the bolted slabby arete until reaching the first ledge. Continue up a series of mantles until reaching the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, optional gear, two chain anchors.
content.location: Right bolted line of Eye of the Pyramid.

climbs.name: Eye of the Pyramid
climbs.fa: Bruce Rubio, Bob Kutch, Benjamin Oberman, John Zimmerman 12-96

content.description: Left side of the wall, starts on a slab past one bolt to a set of boulders.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor, no chains. Walk off to climbers left.
content.location: Left most climb of the OverHung Pinnacle.

content.description: Climb up the fun and crimpy face, crux passing the 2nd bolt, to the summit block.
content.location: Far left of the Overhang Pinnacle area.

content.description: This climb begins atop On Belay with God, however both climbs can be combined into one pitch with a 70 meter rope. Extended draws are recommended on the 2nd and 3rd bolts to avoid rope drag.There are two variations possible at the beginning of the route and the second at the first roof. The first is a 5.11a that begins to the left of Black Powder and passes one bolt before meeting back up at the first roof. The second, a 5.12a, rather than traverse left at the roof go straight up passing two bolts until meeting up the last bolt of Black Powder.
content.location: Right most side of the Overhung Pinnacle.
